grey.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: having the colour of dark clouds, neither black nor white
grey.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: an old lady with grey hair
grey.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She was a tall thin woman who had gone grey early.
grey.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: looking pale because you are tired, frightened, or ill
grey.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: As he listened, his face went grey with shock.
grey.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: the grey anonymous men in government offices
visions of a grey and empty world
grey.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if the weather is grey, the sky is full of clouds and the sun is not bright
grey.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the colour of dark clouds, neither black nor white
grey.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Do you have these skirts in grey?
grey.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if someone greys, their hair becomes grey
grey.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Jim was greying a little at the temples.
a full head of greying hair
grey.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: grey trade involves buying goods from someone abroad who is not an official supplier and selling them at a price which is lower than that charged for goods from an official supplier
grey.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: the grey trade in some prescription drugs
